# mappedPhysicalInputNames(forElementAlias:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the physical input elements to which the user remaps the given input element.

## Declaration

```swift
func mappedPhysicalInputNames(forElementAlias elementAlias: String) -> Set<String>
```

## Parameters

- **elementAlias**: The name of the input element too which physical input elements remap. For possible values, see [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/extended-gamepad-input-names].

## Return Value

The names of the physical input element to which the user remaps the given element.

## Discussion

For example, if the user maps a physical press of A button , B button, and X button to button B, then passing [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/GCInputButtonB-6z361] returns a set that contains [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/GCInputButtonA-8z15w], [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/GCInputButtonB-6z361], and [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/GCInputButtonX-32i2z].

## Remapping input elements

- **hasRemappedElements**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the user remaps elements in this profile.
- **mappedElementAlias(forPhysicalInputName:)**: Returns the name of the input element to which the user remaps the given physical element.
- **GCControllerUserCustomizationsDidChange**: A notification that posts when the user customizes the button mappings or other settings of a controller.
